TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WebMessageBodyStyle extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: An enumeration that specifies whether to wrap parameter and return values.

remarks.format:
## Remarks When the service or client serializes parameters and return values to a message, it writes them within infrastructure-provided XML elements and are *wrapped*. Sometimes developers do not want the service to write these extra XML elements. The WebMessageBodyStyle enumeration specifies whether to wrap parameters and return values.
This enumeration is used with the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebGetAttribute> and the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebInvokeAttribute> to control how the data passed to and from a service operation appears on the wire. Both attributes default to Bare.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle Bare = int32(0)

Docs.summary: Both requests and responses are not wrapped.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle Wrapped = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Both requests and responses are wrapped.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle WrappedRequest = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Requests are wrapped, responses are not wrapped.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.Web.WebMessageBodyStyle WrappedResponse = int32(3)

Docs.summary: Responses are wrapped, requests are not wrapped.
